titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize LJS 47: De institutione musica

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize LJS 47: De institutione musica are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: 15th-century copy of a Latin treatise on the Pythagorean-based theory of ancient Greek music, in which the text reflects an older (10th-century) tradition and the numerous diagrams related to ratio and pitch demonstrate later developments in the tradition.

support.watermark: Similar to Briquet, Soleil, 13977 (Fleurus and Namur, 1487-1491) and 13979 (variants made in France and used in France, the Netherlands, Belgium, and the Rhineland, 1512-1540).

supportDesc.extent: 52 leaves : 281 x 204 (206 x 142) mm. bound to 291 x 211 mm

collation.p: Paper, 52; 1¹²(missing first 2 leaves) 2-4¹⁰ 5⁸ 6⁴; [1-52]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 39-41 lines; ruled in lead, with little of the ruling now visible.

decoDesc.decoNote: Diagrams and tables throughout in various combinations of red, blue, and brown ink; 2-line initials and paragraph marks in red or blue; headings, roman numerals in text, and a few marginal notes in red; capitals touched with red.

binding.p: Early 18th-century (?) parchment over pasteboard with parchment-cord clasps and pastedowns and endleaves with the watermark S. Bartolomeo Delle Fabbriche; Boeci De Music Ms. written on spine in ink.

history.provenance: Sold by J & J Lubrano to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, 1997.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.

keywords.term: Music, Greek and Roman--Early works to 1800
